intro: Poikilospermum lanceolatum, commonly known as the narrow-leafed poikilospermum, is a member of the Rubiaceae family. It is a shrub native to tropical regions of Africa, characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces small, red or yellow fruits that contain elliptical seeds with distinctive color patterns. It thrives in humid, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
